comments.html:
Hi Ivan, I just found your blog - really interesting articles! I highly recommend you the free Pro Git [1] book, available in English and German. For practice there are two great interactive visual tutorials for git, see Git Real [2] and Learn Git Branching [3].

[1] https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2
[2] http://gitreal.codeschool.com/levels/1/challenges/1
[3] http://learngitbranching.js.org/
comments.name: Patrick

comments.html:
Hi! Glad to hear you like my blog ;))

The Git Pro book is already on the "recommended self-study materials" list. Honestly, my personal recommendation would be not to go for any tutorial etc. but to invest time into reading that book. Yeah, I know that doesn't fly well today...
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Completely agree with you. Git is a great tool for version control. If someone wants to learn Git, a great place is to start with a tutorial that is aimed at beginners, like this one: https://www.cloudways.com/blog/git-tutorial-for-beginners-version-control/
comments.name: oliver
